title: Do patent holders have to use their patents? If they don't use it, does the time they can hold it for a decrease? - Quora
tags: Legal Issues and Law in Everyday Life

response.answer_text: Patent holders do not have to practice the patented invention and the patent term remains unaffected as long as patent maintenance fees are paid. Often, maintenance fees are not paid on these type of patented inventions in which case the patent is abandoned and the invention enters the public domain. Overwhelmingly, most patent holders do not use their inventions and even less generate sufficient revenue to offset the costs of obtaining and maintaining a patent. Hence, the expected value of a patent is negative.
There are countries, like India, where it is required to prove that the technology is being used. In the US there is no such requirement.

The concept you are referring to is 'working' a patent, and there is no requirement in most places to work your patent. That's why I have no problem with patent trolls. It would however be a great idea to introduce working requirements…
